findings.rationale: An indefinite duration may lead to perpetual obligations that are burdensome and uncertain, especially if the information becomes obsolete or irrelevant over time.
findings.evidence_quote: This Agreement shall remain in effect indefinitely and shall survive termination of any business relationship between the parties.

findings.risk_title: Lack of Definition of Reasonable Precautions
findings.rationale: The term 'reasonable precautions' is vague and can lead to disputes regarding what constitutes adequate measures to protect confidential information.
findings.evidence_quote: to take all reasonable precautions to protect such Confidential Information.

findings.risk_title: Return of Information May Be Burdensome
findings.rationale: The obligation to return all confidential information could be logistically challenging and may not account for data that is integrated into other systems or processes.
findings.evidence_quote: Upon termination, the Receiving Party shall return all Confidential Information to the Disclosing Party.

findings.rationale: Limiting the governing law to California may not be suitable for parties located in different jurisdictions, potentially complicating dispute resolution.
findings.evidence_quote: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of California.
